input:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
finalAnswer: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.

answers: G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.

G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: An expert who specializes in preparing and reviewing financial statements, including notes and disclosures, and is familiar with GAAP requirements for lease accounting and reporting.

During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: A certified public accountant (CPA) with extensive experience in financial statement review and auditing, familiar with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) standards.

3. **Applicable standards**: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) standards for review engagements require the accountant to modify the report when they become aware of a material departure from GAAP.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.

J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.

E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: An experienced public accountant who regularly conducts reviews of nonissuer entities, such as non-publicly traded companies and non-profit organizations, and is well-versed in the requirements for review reports under these circumstances.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: A certified public accountant (CPA) with extensive experience in financial statement review and auditing, familiar with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) standards.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: An expert who specializes in preparing and reviewing financial statements, including notes and disclosures, and is familiar with GAAP requirements for lease accounting and reporting.

During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.

J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: A certified public accountant (CPA) with extensive experience in financial statement review and auditing, familiar with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) standards.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
additional_args.persona_description: An expert who specializes in preparing and reviewing financial statements, including notes and disclosures, and is familiar with GAAP requirements for lease accounting and reporting.

additional_args.input_str:
During an engagement to review the financial statements of a nonissuer, an accountant becomes aware of several leases that should be capitalized, but are not capitalized. The accountant considers these leases to be material to the financial statements. The accountant decides to modify the standard review report because management will not capitalize the leases. Under these circumstances, the accountant should

A) Declare that the financial statements are not in accordance with GAAP.
B) Issue an unmodified opinion with an emphasis of matter paragraph.
C) Disclose the departure from GAAP in a separate paragraph of the accountant's report.
D) Refuse to issue a report until the leases are capitalized.
E) State that the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
G) Issue an adverse opinion because of the departure from GAAP.
H) Emphasize that the financial statements are for limited use only.
I) Express limited assurance on the entity's financial statements.
J) Express no assurance of any kind on the entity's financial statements.
additional_args.current_draft: F) Issue a disclaimer of opinion due to the departure from GAAP.
